p.The UCF Professional Tennis Management (: The UCF Professional Tennis Management (PTM) certificate is in collaboration with USTA-U, a division of the United States Tennis Association (USTA), in order to develop the next generation of tennis management leaders.

courseSection0.text: The UCF Professional Tennis Management (PTM) certificate is in collaboration with USTA-U, a division of the United States Tennis Association (USTA), in order to develop the next generation of tennis management leaders.

courseSection0.text0:
Complete the following: 
HFT2434 - Introduction to Professional Tennis Management (3)
HFT3357 - Sport and Club Event Operations (3)
HFT3384 - Sport and Club Enterprise Management (3)
HFT3670 - Hospitality and Event Risk Management (3)
courseSection0.text1:
Earn at least 1 credits from the following: 
HFT3940 - Internship I (1 - 99)
Earn at least 1 credits from the following: 
HFT4941 - Internship II (1 - 99)
Earn at least 1 credits from the following: 
HFT4944 - Internship III (1 - 99)

li.All 15 credit hours used towards the cer: All 15 credit hours used towards the certificate must be earned at UCF.
li.No course grade lower than a \u201cC\u20:
No course grade lower than a “C” grade will be accepted for each course
requirement.
li.The average GPA for all courses complete:
The average GPA for all courses completed must be equivalent to 3.0 or
higher.
No credit by exam may be used.

courseSection0.text:
Certificate Requirements
All 15 credit hours used towards the certificate must be earned at UCF.
No course grade lower than a “C” grade will be accepted for each course
requirement.
The average GPA for all courses completed must be equivalent to 3.0 or
higher.
Foreign Language Requirement
None

Other Requirements
No credit by exam may be used.
